Botox is a chemical substance used for various medical and cosmetic purposes, including the treatment of ADHD. ADHD, on the other hand, is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by symptoms of inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity. While ADHD is not a chemical entity, it is mentioned in the context of the paragraph as a condition being treated with Botox, which makes it relevant to the discussion of chemical entities.
